title: Drawing, "Costume Design for Dashing Blades", 1938
medium: Brush and gouche, graphite on cream paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper right: "Dashing Blades" / Glamour girl. No. 1.; left center: ?; arrow pointing to legs, left: flesh / Bare / & / tights; right: white tight; lower right: Back? / Blk Ribbon on leg?
creditline: Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer
description: Costume for a female dancer. The faceless dancer wears a headdress composed of a calla lily and leaves around the collar. Leaves also form a bra over her chest. At her midsection, more leaves and another calla lily tied with black ribbon that runs down and around her left leg. Her right arm is raised, and her left is covered by a green glove. Right margin shows a light study for a calla lilly.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Costume Design for Dashing Blades", 1938.
1938. Brush and gouche, graphite on cream paper. Gift of Mrs. E. McKnight Kauffer. 1963-39-265.
